page.title: 10TREE PLANTING IN BIRSTALL
page.content: A tree planting scheme has been organised by the Parish council and the tree warden, Mr. Boden. Trees are being planted because there are a lot of dead and dying trees in the area. 180 have been planted so far, all of them in public view. {The Methodist Church}is making a book, which contains{information about {the trees,}where they are planted, what type they are and who paid for them to be planted. The information has been hand written in beautiful script. Various types of trees have been planted including Eucalyptus, Scots Pine, Purple Beech and Wild Cherry. This type of activity has been going on for a number of years all over the country, not just in Birstall, following the destruction of so many elms from Dutch Elm Disease.
